intro: Spyridium tricolor, commonly known as the three-color spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant produces three distinct colors on its flowers—white, yellow, and red—hence its common name. Spyridium tricolor thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
